file_content.text: Lem! Stop chewing on--do I need to get out the penalty collar?
We'll tame the Nightmare Lands yet.
I have the materials you asked for.
I knew you'd fare better than the others. Third time's the charm.
And I hear the local wraid population has taken a sudden dive. Interesting, that.
May I--? Oh, yes, this should complete my vaccine perfectly. We'll start mass-producing it immediately.
How long before you can start distributing the vaccine?
The sooner, the better.
Not long. Probably get a few more cases like Lem in the meantime, but such is science.
Good to hear.
That was a worthless chore.
I realize collecting sap isn't particularly exciting. But it had to be done.
You hear that, Lem? Our work here is done.
Gruh! Nuh!
Too bad there's nothing I can do about your condition. Oh well. I can always use a willing test subject.
Keep your wits about you in the Nightmare Lands. You don't want to end up like Lem here.
Nah! Gruh!
Apologies, my lord.
Excuse the tantrum.
Lem here wandered too far into the Nightmare Lands, went completely mad.
Now he's helping me perfect my new vaccine. A remarkable specimen, but tedious company.
As long as he keeps his hands to himself, we won't have a problem.
He'd better behave.
Of course, my lord.
I sense much corruption within him.
He seems... tainted.
He's deteriorated far beyond any hope of recovery. Still, he's been a model test subject.
You should put him down before he hurts somebody.
He looks dangerous.
Oh, he's harmless. Just don't make eye contact.
You're telling me simply being in the Nightmare Lands was enough to drive him insane?
The land itself did this?
Fascinating region, isn't it? Dangerous, though. Hence the necessity of my work.
What's this vaccine you're working on?
Vaccine?
Just a little inoculation I've been cooking up.
That's terrible.
Oh no, I actually quite like the--ah, you mean Lem. Right.
Clinical trials of the vaccine have been promising. My serum repels the Nightmare Lands' degenerative effects and boosts pain tolerance.
Nah! Pain! Pain!
All my formula requires is the catalyst--sap from a very special tree in the Nightmare Lands.
Unfortunately, the sap is a delicacy of the local wraid population. Something to wash down all those troops they've been snacking on.
I take it the wraid don't want anyone stealing their dessert.
They're guarding the sap?
The two expeditions I sent ended... violently, judging by the screaming comm babble.
Can't you just use the sap from a different tree?
Find an alternative.
No other tree has been corrupted so thoroughly. Its sap has all kinds of unique properties.
You're getting Imperial soldiers killed over... sap?
This is a waste of resources.
Well, sure, it sounds petty when you put it like that. But think about the big picture.
My vaccine will allow us to one-up the Republic and establish a solid foothold in the Nightmare Lands.
Surely you have nothing to fear from the Nightmare Lands, my lord? If you can get that sap, you're welcome to a complimentary dose of my serum.
Name your price, just get me that sap so I can complete my serum. I'll even throw in a dose of the first batch.
That sap is crucial to our progress here. Get me some, and I'll gladly give you a sample of my completed serum.
We must have that sap. Get me some, and I'll give you a sample of the first batch of my completed serum.
That vaccine of yours could do us some good. I'll take care of it.
You can count on me.
Agreed.
One more thing--constant exposure to the corrupted sap has... changed the wraid, mutated them, into... something worse.
They're a constant threat to our operations. If you were to thin their numbers, I'm sure you'd be compensated.
No deal. [Refuse quest]
Surely you don't want to see more drooling buffoons like Lem here.
Try not to disturb the patient.
